alert.note: Alert for Harlan (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 18 at 6:36PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Phillips, northwestern Franklin and eastern Harlan Counties through 715 PM CDT... At 635 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Woodruff, or 15 miles north of Phillipsburg, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Alma around 645 PM CDT. Republican City and Harlan County Dam around 655 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Naponee and Bloomington. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
